source: The Local Government Act 1985 is an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.
target: The Local Government Act 1985 was an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom.

source: Its main effect was to abolish the six county councils of the metropolitan counties that had been set up in 1974, 11 years earlier, by the Local Government Act 1972, along with the Greater London Council that had been established in 1965.
target: Its main effect was to abolish the county councils of the metropolitan counties that had been set up in 1974 by the Local Government Act 1972, along with the Greater London Council that had been established in 1965.

source: Following the victory of the Conservative Party at the 1979 general election, Margaret Thatcher's government were involved in a series of high-profile disputes with the GLC and Metropolitan County Councils.
target: The Act was passed by Margaret Thatcher's government after a series of disputes between the councils and the central government.

source: The core provision, section 1, stated that "the Greater London Council; and the metropolitan county councils" shall cease to exist.
target: The main provision, section 1 stated that "the Greater London Council; and the metropolitan county councils" shall not exist anymore.

source: It came into effect on 1 April 1986, with some powers being devolved to the metropolitan boroughs themselves and London boroughs and others to joint authorities (such as for fire or police purposes) consisting of members of each of the metropolitan district councils within each county.
target: It came into effect on 1 April 1986. The metropolitan boroughs and London boroughs got some of the powers of the former institutions, but others went to central government.

source: At the time of the Act, one third of the population of England were living in Greater London and the metropolitan counties.
target: At the time of the Act, one third of the population of England were living in Greater London and the metropolitan counties.

source: Six metropolitan county councils were abolished and the local authority of Greater London.
target: The act established a system of joint-boards to take over some of the functions of the abolished councils in the metropolitan counties and in Greater London.

source: In the Aztec religion, Huitzilopochtli is a deity of war, sun, human sacrifice, and the patron of the city of Tenochtitlan.
target: In Aztec mythology, Huitzilopochtli, also spelled Uitzilopochtli, was a god of war, a sun god, and the patron of the city of Tenochtitlan.

source: These children, angered by the manner by which their mother became impregnated, conspired to kill her.
target: His sister, Coyolxauhqui, tried to kill their mother because she became pregnant in a shameful way (by a ball of feathers).

source: Huitzilopochtli burst forth from his mother's womb in full armor and fully grown, or in other versions of the story, burst forth from the womb and immediately put on his gear.
target: Her offspring, Huitzilopochtli, learned of this plan while still in the womb, and before it was put into action, sprang from his mother's womb fully grown and fully armed and killed his sister Coyolxauhqui, together with many of his 400 brothers and sisters.

source: He also chased after his brothers, who fled from him and became scattered all over the sky.
target: He then tossed his sister's head into the sky, where it became the moon, so that his mother would be comforted in seeing her daughter in the sky every night. He also threw his other brothers and sisters into the sky, where they became the stars.

source: Hrant Dink ( ; ] ; September 15, 1954 – January 19, 2007) was a Turkish-Armenian intellectual, editor-in-chief of "Agos", journalist and columnist.
target: Hrant Dink (, IPA: həɹɑnt diːnk) (15 September 1954 – 19 January 2007) was a Turkish-Armenian editor, journalist and columnist.

source: As editor-in-chief of the bilingual Turkish-Armenian newspaper "Agos", Dink was a prominent member of the Armenian minority in Turkey.
target: As editor-in-chief of the bilingual Turkish-Armenian newspaper "Agos" (Ակօս), Dink was a prominent member of the Armenian minority in Turkey.

source: Dink was assassinated in Istanbul on January 19, 2007 by Ogün Samast, a 17-year-old Turkish nationalist.
target: Hrant Dink was assassinated in Istanbul on 19 January 2007, by Ogün Samast, a 17 year old ultra-nationalist Turk.

target: It is located in Turner County, and 784 people lived there at the 2010 census.

source: The Long March (October 1934 – October 1935) was a military retreat undertaken by the Red Army of the Communist Party of China, the forerunner of the People's Liberation Army, to evade the pursuit of the Kuomintang (KMT or Chinese Nationalist Party) army.
target: The Long March is the retreat of Mao Zedong and the Communists in 1934-35.

source: The Communists, under the eventual command of Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai, escaped in a circling retreat to the west and north, which reportedly traversed over 9,000 kilometers (5600 miles) over 370 days.
target: They trekked 6,000 miles over 370 days, and only 8,000 survived out of 100,000 people.

source: The Long March began the ascent to power of Mao Zedong, whose leadership during the retreat gained him the support of the members of the party.
target: Mao Zedong rose up as a leader during this time.

source: The ideological confrontation between the CCP and the KMT soon evolved into the first phase of the Chinese Civil War.
target: This brought the Chinese Civil War.

source: Amelia Mary Earhart ( , born July 24, 1897; disappeared July 2, 1937) was an American aviation pioneer and author.
target: Amelia Mary Earhart (July 24, 1897 – and disappeared in July 2, 1937) was an American aviator, one of the first women to fly a plane long distances.

source: Earhart was the first female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
target: She was the first woman to fly a plane by herself across the Atlantic Ocean.

source: She set many other records, wrote best-selling books about her flying experiences, and was instrumental in the formation of The Ninety-Nines, an organization for female pilots.
target: She broke many records and showed how air travel had moved forward. She also wrote books, most of them were about her flights.

source: During an attempt to make a circumnavigational flight of the globe in 1937 in a Purdue-funded Lockheed Model 10-E Electra, Earhart and navigator Fred Noonan disappeared over the central Pacific Ocean near Howland Island.
target: Earhart vanished over the South Pacific Ocean in July 2, 1937 while trying to fly around the world.

source: Many researchers believe that Earhart and Noonan ran out of fuel while searching for Howland Island, ditched at sea, and perished.
target: The most plausible though is many researchers believe, which is that the Electra ran out of fuel and that Earhart and Noonan ditched at sea.

source: TIGHAR's research has produced a range of archaeological and anecdotal evidence supporting this hypothesis.
target: However, there is a range of documented, archaeological, and anecdotal evidence supporting the hypothesis that Earhart and Noonan found Gardner Island, uninhabited at the time, landed the Electra on a flat reef near the wreck of a freighter, and sent sporadic radio messages from there.

source: The airline transport pilot licence (ATPL), or in the United States of America, an airline transport pilot (ATP) certificate is the highest level of aircraft pilot certificate.
target: The Airline Transport Pilot License (ATPL) is the highest level of aviator qualification or license.

source: Those certified as airline transport pilots (unconditional) are authorized to act as pilot in command on scheduled air carriers' aircraft under CFR 14 Part 121.
target: Those certified as Airline Transport Pilots are authorized to act as pilot-in-command of an aircraft having a maximum weight over 12500 lb or having over 9 passenger seats.

source: Any pilot operating an aircraft for pay must start by obtaining a commercial pilot licence (CPL).
target: Any pilot operating an aircraft for money must start by obtaining a Commercial pilot licence (CPL).

source: Materials that detonate (the front of the chemical reaction moves faster through the material than the speed of sound) are said to be "high explosives" and materials that deflagrate are said to be "low explosives".
target: There are two types of explosives: low explosives and high explosives. High explosives "detonate" (= explode with bursts). Sometimes, even a low explosive may detonate.

source: An explosive is classified as a low or high explosive according to its rate of combustion: low explosives burn rapidly (or deflagrate), while high explosives detonate.
target: Low explosives "conflagrate" (= burn very fast).

source: Sensitivity refers to the ease with which an explosive can be ignited or detonated, i.e., the amount and intensity of shock, friction, or heat that is required.
target: Any shock, friction, or heat makes primary explosives to burn or blast fast.

source: Explosives based on ammonium nitrate have little or no water resistance as ammonium nitrate is highly soluble in water and is hygroscopic.
target: Gunpowder and ammonium nitrate are low explosives.

source: A primary explosive is an explosive that is extremely sensitive to stimuli such as impact, friction, heat, static electricity, or electromagnetic radiation. Some primary explosives are also known as contact explosives. Primary explosives are often used in detonators or to trigger larger charges of less sensitive secondary explosives. A secondary explosive is less sensitive than a primary explosive and requires substantially more energy to be initiated. Secondary explosives are used in larger quantities in an explosive train and are usually initiated by a smaller quantity of a primary explosive.
target: High explosives produce more pressure than low explosives but low explosives are more safe to use. Primary explosives are very unstable and rapidly react to shock, friction, and heat. Secondary explosives are much more safe to use and do not react very fast to shock, friction, and heat. Primary explosives are used as "detonators": that is, to cause the secondary explosives to explode.

source: Examples of secondary explosives include TNT and RDX.
target: TNT, dynamite, hexogen, HMX and Torpex are examples of secondary explosives.

source: A low explosive is usually a mixture of a combustible substance and an oxidant that decomposes rapidly (deflagration); however, they burn more slowly than a high explosive, which has an extremely fast burn rate.
target: A low explosive is a material, which burns very fast, but does not explode generally.

source: They can be divided into two explosives classes differentiated by sensitivity: primary explosive and secondary explosive.
target: High explosives may belong to different groups: primary explosives and secondary explosives.

source: Shipping labels and tags may include both United Nations and national markings.
target: The United Nations has advised use of such markings.

source: Papeete (pronounced ] ) is the capital city of French Polynesia, an overseas collectivity of the French Republic in the Pacific Ocean.
target: Papeete is the capital city of French Polynesia, an overseas collectivity of the French Republic.

source: The commune of Papeete is located on the island of Tahiti, in the administrative subdivision of the Windward Islands, of which Papeete is the administrative capital.
target: The commune is located on the north-west of the island of Tahiti in the Pacific Ocean.

source: The urban area of Papeete had a total population of 136,771 inhabitants at the August 2017 census, 26,926 of whom lived in the commune of Papeete proper. The urban area of Papeete had a total population of 136,771 inhabitants at the August 2017 census, 26,926 of whom lived in the commune of Papeete proper.
target: As of 2017, the population of Papeete was 26,926.

source: Long Wittenham is a village and small civil parish about 3 mi north of Didcot, and 3.5 mi southeast of Abingdon. The village is on the outside of a meander in the River Thames, on slightly higher ground than the flood plain around it.
target: Long Wittenham is a village on the south bank of the River Thames in South Oxfordshire. Long Wittenham is in the Thames Valley 3 mi north of Didcot, and 3.5 mi southeast of Abingdon.

source: 6th century cropmarks outline a large group of buildings, which indicate, if not a royal palace, then certainly a high status Saxon enclosure, and the variety and number of objects found in Saxon burial sites around the village would appear to support this.
target: There are crop marks (dating from the 6th Century) that there must have been a large collection of buildings, maybe a royal palace or at least high status Saxon enclosure.

source: These large, Saxon burial sites also indicate a sizeable population that lasted for many years.
target: These large, Saxon burial sites also indicate a good sized population, that lasted over many years.

source: The Domesday Book of 1086 records the village in one of two entries for Wittenham identifiable as this part of the modern village by government-registered manorial descent (such as the Feet of fines for example.
target: The village was mentioned in the Domesday Book.

source: By the Tudor era, parish records show it had a population of around 200, with arable crops: wheat, oats, barley and rye being farmed.
target: By Tudor times, it had a population of around 200, with crops: wheat, oats, barley and even rye.

source: Local legend claims that Oliver Cromwell addressed the villagers on his way to his niece's wedding, in neighbouring Little Wittenham.
target: Following a local legend Oliver Cromwell addressed the villagers on his way to his niece's wedding, in neighbouring Little Wittenham.

source: The base of the village preaching cross dates from the 7th century.
target: The village Cross has First Millennial origins: the base dating from the 7th century.

source: Saint Birinus preached here when he brought Christianity to the area.
target: St. Birinus preached here when he brought Christianity to the area.

source: The Church of England parish church of Saint Mary, begun around 1120, is on the site of a previous Saxon church.
target: The Church of England parish church of Saint Mary, begun around 1120, is on the site of a previous Saxon church.

source: Cruck Cottage can be architecturally dated to being around 800 years old and consequently locals have claimed it may be the oldest house in South Oxfordshire.
target: Cruck Cottage can be architecturally dated to being around 800 years old and as such is (possibly) the oldest house in South Oxfordshire.

source: Its site was The Three Poplars public house.
target: The building housing Pendon Museum, originally started life as The Three Poplars - a working man's pub.

source: The shape and length of the apex can vary, sometimes within a single inscription.
target: The shape and length of the apex can be different.

source: While virtually all apices consist of a line sloping up to the right, the line can be more or less curved, and varies in length from less than half the height of a letter to more than the height of a letter.
target: While pretty much all apices are made up of a line sloping up to the right, the line can be more or less curved, and is different in length from less than half the height of a letter to more than the height of a letter.

source: Sometimes, it is adorned at the top with a distinct hook, protruding to the left.
target: Sometimes, it is put at the top with a hook, pointing out to the left.

source: Rather than being centered over the vowel it modifies, the apex is often considerably displaced to the right.
target: Rather than being centered over the vowel it changes, the apex is often drawn to the right.

source: The apex later developed into the acute accent, which is still used to mark vowel length in some languages, namely, Czech, Slovak, Hungarian and Irish, and for the historically long vowels of Icelandic.
target: Later, it developed into the acute accent, which is still used in some languages to mark vowel length. In particular, Czech and Slovak, Hungarian, Irish, and (a long time ago) Icelandic.

source: Although hardly known by most modern Latinists, the use of the sign was actually quite widespread during classical and postclassical times.
target: Although not really known by some modern Latinists, the sign was actually used a lot during classical and postclassical times.

source: The reason why it so often passes unnoticed lies probably in its smallish size and usually thinner nature in comparison with the lines that compose the letter on which it stands.
target: The reason why it is not usually noticed is probably because of its smallish size and the fact that it is usually quite thin.

source: Yet the more careful observer will soon start to notice apices in the exhibits of any museum, not only in many of the more formal epigraphic inscriptions, but also in handwritten palaeographic documents.
target: People who look carefully will soon start to notice apices in the exhibits of any museum, not only in many of the more formal epigraphic writings, but also in handwritten palaeographic things.

source: In modern Latin orthography, long vowels are sometimes marked by a macron, a sign that had always been used, and still is, to mark metrically long "syllables" (more recently called "heavy" syllables).
target: Forgetting the apex, modern Latin spelling has recently started marking long vowels by using the macron.

source: To confuse matters further, the acute accent is sometimes used in Latin to mark stressed syllables, as in Spanish, when the macron is not used.
target: This has caused confusion between syllable and vowel length in Latin, and most western dictionaries still cannot describe the nature of Latin vowels properly because of this. To make even more confusion, the acute accent is sometimes used in Latin to mark stressed syllables, just like in Spanish, when the macron is not used.

source: The apex is often contrasted with another ancient Latin diacritic, the sicilicus, which is said to have been used above "consonants" to denote that they should be pronounced double.
target: The apex is often thought to be the opposite of another ancient Latin diacritic, the sicilicus, which is said to have been used above "consonants" to show that they should be pronounced as doubles.

source: However, in his article "Apex and Sicilicus", Revilo P. Oliver argues that they are one and the same sign, a "geminationis nota", which was used over any letter to indicate that the letter should be read twice.
target: However, in his article "Apex and Sicilicus", Revilo P. Oliver says that they are the same sign, a "geminationis nota".

source: If Revilo P. Oliver is right, the apex as a sign denoting vowel length would have its origin in the time when long vowels were written double.
target: If Revilo P. Oliver is right, the apex as a sign showing vowel length would have been made in the time when long vowels were written double.

source: However, Oliver's view that the two marks were identical has recently been challenged; see sicilicus.
target: However, Oliver's view that the two marks were the same has recently been challenged.

source: The Mental Capacity Act 2005 (c 9) is an Act of the Parliament of the United Kingdom applying to England and Wales.
target: In the UK, this law is called the Mental Capacity Act (2005).

source: Its primary purpose is to provide a legal framework for acting and making decisions on behalf of adults who lack the capacity to make particular decisions for themselves.
target: The purpose is to make sure that decisions taken are in the person's interest.

source: These are designed to protect people who lack capacity to make particular decisions, but also to maximise their ability to make decisions, or to participate in decision-making, as far as they are able to do so.
target: Mental capacity in law is a term used to describe a person's ability to be able to make decisions for themselves and to be able to understand what those decisions will mean for them.

source: In each episode, Mr. Dressup would dress up in a costume from his Tickle Trunk, and lead children in an imagination game.
target: In each show Mr. Dressup would dress up in costumes that he would find in a box he called his ""Tickle Trunk"".

source: The series continued production until its final taping in February 1996, when Coombs retired.
target: His TV show did not stop until February 1996.

source: Repeats continued to be shown on CBC Television until they were discontinued in 2006.
target: Repeats of his TV show were shown on CBC Television until 2006.

source: After retirement, Coombs continued to work as an entertainer, playing roles in Ross Petty's Christmas pantomimes of "Peter Pan", "Cinderella", and "Aladdin", narrated a 2002 Canadian revival of the British animated television series, "Simon in the Land of Chalk Drawings", and acted as a spokesman for children's charities.
target: After he retired from TV Coombs continued to work entertaining children and did a lot of work to raise money for many children's charities.

source: Coombs became a Canadian citizen in 1994.
target: Coombs became a Canadian citizen in 1994.

source: In 1996, he was named a Member of the Order of Canada.
target: The same year, he was named a Member of the Order of Canada.

source: Coombs suffered a stroke on September 10, 2001, and died on September 18, 2001 at the age of 73..
target: Coombs had a stroke on September 10, 2001. He died on September 18, 2001 in Toronto, Ontario. He was 73 years old when he died.

source: Javier Felipe Ricardo Pérez de Cuéllar de la Guerra KCMG ( ; ] ; born January 19, 1920) is a Peruvian diplomat who served as the fifth Secretary-General of the United Nations from January 1, 1982 to December 31, 1991. Javier Pérez de Cuéllar was born on January 19, 1920 in Lima.
target: Javier Michael Pérez de Cuéllar Mahan (born January 19, 1920) is a Peruvian diplomat. He was the fifth Secretary-General of the United Nations, from January 1, 1982 to December 31, 1991.

source: He ran unsuccessfully against Alberto Fujimori for President of Peru in 1995 and following Fujimori's resignation over corruption charges, he was Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs from November 2000 until July 2001.
target: From November 2000 to July 2001, he was the 135th Prime Minister of Peru. In 1995, he ran unsuccessfully against Alberto Fujimori for President of Peru.

source: In September 2004, he stepped down from his position as Peru's Ambassador to France, where he formerly resided.
target: In September 2004, he stepped down from his position as Peru's Ambassador to France.

source: At the age of , Pérez de Cuéllar is currently both the oldest living former Peruvian prime minister and Secretary General of the United Nations.
target: After the death of Kurt Waldheim in 2007, he became the oldest living former Secretary General of the United Nations.

source: He studied in Colegio San Agustín of Lima, and then at Pontifical Catholic University of Peru.
target: He studied in Colegio San Agustín of Lima, and then at Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú.

source: Pérez de Cuéllar joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1940 and the diplomatic service in 1944, serving subsequently as Secretary at Peru's embassy in France, where he met and married his first wife, Yvette Roberts (died Lisbon, 2013).
target: Pérez de Cuéllar joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1940 and the diplomatic service in 1944, serving subsequently as Secretary at Peru's embassies in France, where he met and married his first wife, the former Yvette Roberts; the United Kingdom, Bolivia, and Brazil.

source: From his first marriage, he has a son, Francisco, born in Paris, and a daughter, Águeda Cristina, born in London.
target: From his first marriage, Mr. Perez de Cuellar has a son, (Francisco, b. Paris), and a daughter, Agueda Cristina (b. London).

source: He was a junior member of the Peruvian delegation to the first session of the General Assembly, which convened in London in 1946, and a member of the delegations to the 25th through 30th sessions of the Assembly.
target: He was a junior member of the Peruvian delegation to the General Assembly at its first session - held in London in 1946-, and a member of the delegations to the 25th through 30th sessions of the Assembly.

source: In 1971, he was appointed permanent representative of Peru to the United Nations, and he led his country's delegation to all sessions of the Assembly from then until 1975.
target: In 1971, he was appointed permanent representative of Peru to the United Nations, and he led his country's delegation to all sessions of the Assembly from then until 1975.

source: In 1973 and 1974, he represented his country in the Security Council, serving as its President at the time of the events in Cyprus in July 1974.
target: In 1973 and 1974, he represented his country in the Security Council, serving as its President at the time of the events in Cyprus in July 1974.

source: On September 18, 1975, he was appointed Special Representative of the Secretary-General in Cyprusa post he held until December 1977, when he rejoined the Peruvian Foreign Service.
target: On 18 September 1975, he was appointed Special Representative of the Secretary-General in Cyprus – a post he held until December 1977-, when he rejoined the Peruvian Foreign Service.

source: On December 31, 1981, Pérez de Cuéllar succeeded Kurt Waldheim as Secretary-General and was re-elected for a second term in October 1986.
target: On December 31, 1981, Pérez de Cuéllar succeeded Kurt Waldheim as Secretary-General and was re-elected for a second term in October 1986.

source: During his two terms, he led mediations between Britain and Argentina in the aftermath of the Falklands War and promoted the efforts of the Contadora Group to bring peace and stability to Central America.
target: During his two terms, he led mediations between Britain and Argentina in the aftermath of the Falklands War and promoted the efforts of the Contadora Group to bring peace and stability to Central America.

source: He also interceded in the negotiations for the independence of Namibia, the conflict in Western Sahara between Morocco and the Polisario Front, the war between Croatian forces seeking independence and the Yugoslav federal as well as local Serb forces, and the Cyprus issue.
target: He also interceded in the negotiations for the independence of Namibia, the conflict in Western Sahara between Morocco and the Polisario Front, and the Cyprus issue.

source: Shortly before the end of his second term, he rejected an unofficial request by members of the Security Council to reconsider his earlier decision not to run for a third term, shortened to two years, as a search for his successor had not, as of then, yielded a consensus candidate.
target: Shortly before the end of his second term, he was unofficially requested by members of the Security Council to run for a third term of two years, to give time for a successor to be found.

source: Crossed is a young adult novel written by Allyson Braithwaite Condie.
target: Crossed is a 2011 dystopian novel by Ally Condie.

source: It is the sequel to "Matched" and the second book in the "Matched" trilogy.
target: The book is the second in a trilogy.

source: Joseph Erlanger (January 5, 1874 – December 5, 1965) was an American physiologist who is best known for his contributions to the field of neuroscience.
target: Joseph Erlanger (5 January, 1874- 5 December, 1965) was an American physiologist.

source: Together with Herbert Spencer Gasser, he identified several varieties of nerve fiber and established the relationship between action potential velocity and fiber diameter. They were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1944 for these achievements. In 1944, they won the Nobel Prize in Medicine or Physiology for these discoveries.
target: He won the 1944 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with Herbert Spencer Gasser, for discovering that different nerve fibres have different functions.

source: The Dissected Till Plains are physiographic sections of the Central Lowlands province, which in turn is part of the Interior Plains physiographic division of the United States, located in southern and western Iowa, northeastern Kansas, the southwestern corner of Minnesota, northern Missouri, eastern Nebraska, and southeastern South Dakota.
target: The Dissected Till Plains are physiographic parts of the Central Lowlands province. In turn, those are part of the Interior Plains physiographic part of the United States.

source: The Dissected Till Plains were formed by pre-Wisconsin glaciations during the Pre-Illinoian Stage.
target: The Dissected Till Plains were created by pre-Wisconsin glaciers during the Pre-Illinoian Stage.

source: Glacial scouring and deposition by the Laurentide Ice Sheet and the later accumulation of loess during the Wisconsin Stage left behind the rolling hills and rich, fertile soils found today in the region.
target: Glacial scouring and deposition by the Laurentide ice sheet and the later accumulation of loess during the Wisconsin Stage created the rolling hills and good, healthy dirt in the region.

source: The region is also the western edge of the Corn Belt.
target: The region is also the western edge of the Corn Belt.

source: Oblique type is a form of type that slants slightly to the right, used for the same purposes as italic type. Unlike italic type, however, it does not use different glyph shapes; it uses the same glyphs as roman type, except slanted.
target: It is used for the same purposes as italic type. But unlike italic type, it does not use different glyph shapes. It uses the same glyphs as Roman type, except slanted.

source: Type designers have described oblique type as less organic and calligraphic than italics, which in some situations may be preferred.
target: Type designers have called oblique as less organic and calligraphic than italics. That may be preferred in some situations.

source: Many sans-serif typefaces use plainer oblique designs instead of italic ones.
target: Many sans serif typefaces use oblique designs instead of italic ones.

source: This is especially true with grotesque designs like Helvetica, which have a spare, industrial aesthetic, and geometric ones like Futura.
target: This is especially true with grotesque designs like Helvetica.

source: Macbeth (Medieval Gaelic: "Mac Bethad mac Findlaích"; Modern Gaelic: "MacBheatha mac Fhionnlaigh"; nicknamed " ", "the Red King"; 1005 – 15 August 1057) was King of Scots from 1040 until his death.
target: Macbeth (Mac Bethad mac Findlaích in Gaelic) was King of Scotland from 1040-1057. Macbeth was probably born around 1005 in Morayshire, Scotland. His name in Gaelic was "Mac Bethad mac Findlaích" (in modern Gaelic, it is "MacBheatha mac Fhionnlaigh").

source: Little is known about Macbeth's early life, although he was the son of Findláech of Moray and may have been a grandson of Malcolm II.
target: His father was Findláech mac Ruaidrí, Mormaer of Moray. Macbeth's mother, Donada, may have been Malcolm II's second daughter.

source: In 1040, Duncan I launched an attack into Moray and was killed in action by Macbeth's troops.
target: On August 17th, 1040, Macbeth murdered King Duncan I in battle and was crowned King of Scotland.

source: Macbeth's stepson Lulach was installed as king soon after. Macbeth succeeded him as King of Alba, apparently with little opposition. Macbeth was initially succeeded by his stepson Lulach, but Lulach ruled for only a few months before also being killed by Malcolm III, whose descendants would rule Scotland until the late 13th century.
target: Macbeth did have a stepson, Lulach, who succeeded him as king but died in 1058. His stepson Lulach became king in Macbeth's place.

source: He was buried on Iona, the traditional resting place of Scottish kings.
target: He was buried in Iona, Scotland.

source: On Duncan's death, Macbeth became king.
target: In the play, Macbeth is an evil king who murders his cousin so he can become king. In real life, Macbeth was more peaceful than this, though he did kill King Duncan I of Scotland.

source: Scottish author Nigel Tranter based one of his historical novels, "MacBeth the King", on the historical figure.
target: William Shakespeare wrote a famous play about him called "Macbeth".

source: Liraglutide, sold under the brand name Victoza among others, is a medication used to treat diabetes mellitus type 2 and obesity.
target: Liraglutide (marketed with brand name Victoza) is a Type 2 diabetes medication.

source: Liraglutide is a glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist (GLP-1 receptor agonist) also known as incretin mimetics.
target: It is a long-acting glucagon like peptide-1 agonist.

source: Liraglutide was approved for medical use in Europe in 2009 and in the United States in 2010.
target: It was approved by the Food and Drug Administration in early 2010.

source: Liraglutide is a medication used for the treatment of type 2 diabetes or obesity.
target: This medication is a once daily treatment of Type 2 diabetes.

source: Paul John Tagliabue ( ; born November 24, 1940) is a former Commissioner of the National Football League.
target: Paul John Tagliabue (; born November 24, 1940) is the former Commissioner of the National Football League.

source: He had previously served as a lawyer for the NFL.
target: Tagliabue had previously served as a lawyer for the NFL.

source: Tagliabue also served as Chairman of Board of Directors of Georgetown University from 2009 to 2015.
target: Tagliabue served as Chairman of Board of Directors of Georgetown University from 2008 to 2015.

source: Alcohol intoxication, also known as drunkenness or alcohol poisoning, is the negative behavior and physical effects due to the recent drinking of ethanol (alcohol). Alcohol intoxication typically begins after two or more alcoholic drinks.
target: Drunkenness means being intoxicated by alcohol. "Alcohol poisoning" means that a person has drunk enough alcohol to cause a coma, dangerously slow breathing, or even death.

source: At higher doses, there may be slurred speech, trouble walking, and vomiting.
target: They may also start vomiting.

source: Acute alcohol poisoning is a medical emergency due to the risk of death from respiratory depression or aspiration of vomit if vomiting occurs while the person is unresponsive.
target: Alcohol poisoning is a medical emergency.

source: An inclinometer or clinometer is an instrument used for measuring angles of slope (or tilt), elevation, or depression of an object with respect to gravity's direction.
target: Clinometer is an instrument that measures vertical slopes,usually the angle between ground or the observer and a tall object.

source: The zero line is parallel to the base, and when the liquid stands on that line, the flat side is horizontal; the 90 degree is perpendicular to the base, and when the liquid stands on that line, the flat side is perpendicular or plumb.
target: A simple way to create a clinometer is to tape a straw to the bottom of a protractor, then tape a piece of string to the 90 degree line.

source: The Medway Valley line is the name given to the railway line linking Strood and the Medway Towns with Maidstone West and onward to Paddock Wood , Tonbridge and London St Pancras International (peak only).
target: The Medway Valley line is a railway line in Kent linking Strood and the Medway Towns with Maidstone West and on to Paddock Wood, Tonbridge and London St Pancras International (peak only).

source: The section from Maidstone West to Tonbridge passes through some of Kent's most picturesque countryside along the narrower sections of the River Medway.
target: The section from Maidstone West to Tonbridge passes through some of Kent's most picturesque countryside along the narrower sections of the River Medway.

source: The line served many rail connected industries, Aveling and Porter just south of Strood, cement works in the Cuxton, Halling and Snodland areas, a newsprint at New Hythe, Lafarge between Aylesford and Maidstone Barracks, Lockmeadow sidings at Maidstone West, Tovil good depot and sand pits at Belting The line serves the following stations: Strood , Cuxton , Halling, Snodland , New Hythe , Aylesford , Maidstone Barracks , Maidstone West , East Farleigh , Wateringbury , Yalding , Beltring , Paddock Wood and Tonbridge
target: The line serves the following stations: Strood, Cuxton, Halling, Snodland, New Hythe, Aylesford, Maidstone Barracks, Maidstone West, East Farleigh, Wateringbury, Yalding, Beltring, Paddock Wood and Tonbridge

source: The Main Rolling stock used on the line is Class 375/3 Electrostars but the other variants of Class 375 may occasionally appear.
target: The main trains used on the line is Class 375 Electrostars.

source: Prior to the May 2012 Timetable changes Class 466 or Class 465 Networkers were used, these units still appear on the line when a 375 unit fails or is unavailable.
target: Before the May 2012 Timetable changes Class 465 and Class 466 Networkers were used, these units still appear on the line when a 375 unit fails or is unavailable.

source: From 23 May 2011, Class 395s became regular peak only visitors to the Medway Valley line, operating a peak high speed service between Maidstone West and St. Pancras International via Strood.
target: In May 2011, Class 395s was introduced on the Medway Valley line, operating a high speed service between Maidstone West and St. Pancras International via Strood.

source: Paul Goma (] ; born October 2, 1935) is a Romanian writer, also known for his activities as a dissident and leading opponent of the communist regime before 1989.
target: Paul Goma (]; born October 2, 1935) is a Romanian writer. He is known for his activities as a dissident and leading opponent of the communist regime before 1989.

source: After 2000, Goma has expressed opinions on World War II, the Holocaust in Romania and the Jews, claims which have led to widespread criticism for antisemitism.
target: After 2000, Goma has expressed opinions on World War II, the Holocaust in Romania and the Jews, claims which have led to widespread criticism for antisemitism.

source: The 1959 Mexico hurricane was the deadliest Pacific hurricane on record.
target: The 1959 Mexico hurricane was one of only two Category 5 Eastern Pacific hurricanes to make landfall in Mexico.

source: First observed south of Mexico on October 23, the cyclone tracked northwestward.
target: It was first observed south of Mexico on October 23.

source: It intensified into a Category 3 hurricane on October 25 and reached Category 4 intensity on the following day.
target: The storm intensified into a Category 3 hurricane on October 25 and a Category 4 the following day.

source: After turning toward the northeast, the hurricane made landfall near Manzanillo, Mexico at peak intensity.
target: The storm later turned toward the northeast and intensified to Category 5 level. It made landfall near Manzanillo, Mexico.

source: Overall, the hurricane inflicted at least $280 million (1959 USD) in damage.
target: The hurricane caused at least $280 million in damage.

source: It killed at least 1,000 people directly, and a total of 1,800 people.
target: More than 1,800 people lost their lives.

source: Naked Lunch is a 1991 drama film co-written and directed by David Cronenberg and starring Peter Weller, Judy Davis, Ian Holm, and Roy Scheider.
target: Naked Lunch is a 1991 science fiction drama movie. It was directed by David Cronenberg.

source: It is an adaptation of William S. Burroughs' 1959 novel of the same name, and an international co-production of Canada, Britain and Japan.
target: It is based on the William S. Burroughs 1959 novel of the same name.

source: The film was released on December 27, 1991, in the United States and April 24, 1992, in the United Kingdom by 20th Century Fox. "Naked Lunch" was released on 27 December 1991 in a limited release of 5 theaters, grossing $64,491 on its opening weekend.
target: "Naked Lunch" was released on December 27, 1991 in the United States and on 24 April 1992 in the United Kingdom.

source: It received positive reviews from critics, but was a box office bomb, garnering only $2.6 million out of a $17–18 million budget due to a limited release.
target: The movie got positive reviews from critics.

source: Roger Ebert gave the film two-and-a-half stars out of four and wrote, "While I admired it in an abstract way, I felt repelled by the material on a visceral level.
target: Movie critic Roger Ebert rated the movie two-and-a-half stars out of four and said "While I admired it in an abstract way, I felt repelled by the material on a visceral level.

source: There is so much dryness, death and despair here, in a life spinning itself out with no joy".
target: There is so much dryness, death and despair here, in a life spinning itself out with no joy".

source: In linguistics, vowel length is the perceived duration of a vowel sound.
target: Vowel length is a feature in languages when how long a vowel is spoken in a word can create a completely different word.

source: Long vowels may or may not be analyzed as separate phonemes.
target: Long vowels in Old English could be written with a bar on top of the vowel like in "gōd" (good)"."

source: The traditional China calendar (officially known as the Rural Calendar []), or Former Calendar , Traditional Calendar or Lunar Calendar , is a lunisolar calendar which reckons years, months and days according to astronomical phenomena.
target: The Chinese calendar, also known as the "agriculture calendar" (農曆/农历), is a lunisolar calendar ("yinyangli").

source: Although modern-day China uses the Gregorian calendar, the traditional Chinese calendar governs holidays—such as the Lantern Festival—in both China and in overseas Chinese communities. The most popular is the Gregorian calendar .
target: Today in China the Gregorian calendar is used for most activities.

source: Dottie West (born Dorothy Marie Marsh; October 11, 1932 – September 4, 1991) was an American country music singer and songwriter.
target: Dottie West born Dorothy Marie Marsh; October 11, 1932 – September 4, 1991) was an American country musician and songwriter.

source: Along with her friends and fellow recording artists Patsy Cline and Loretta Lynn, she is considered one of the genre's most influential and groundbreaking female artists.
target: She was one of the genre's most influential artists.

source: Dottie West's career started in the 1960s, with her Top 10 hit, "Here Comes My Baby Back Again", which won her a Grammy Award for Best Female Country Vocal Performance in 1965, the first female in Country Music to receive a Grammy.
target: Her career began in the 1960s with her Top 10 hit "Here Comes My Baby Back Again". That won her a Grammy Award for Best Female Country Performance in 1965.

source: In the early 1970s, West wrote a popular commercial for the Coca-Cola company, titled "Country Sunshine", which reached No. 2 on Billboard's Hot Country Singles in 1973.
target: In the 1970s, West wrote a popular commercial for the Coca-Cola company, "Country Sunshine", which hit #2 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles list in 1973.

source: West's hometown of McMinnville, Tennessee, dedicated Highway 56 to her memory, naming it the Dottie West Memorial Highway. Dorothy Marie "Dottie" Marsh was born on October 11, 1932, to Pelina Artha (née Jones; 1915 – 1970) and William Hollis Marsh (1908 – 1967) in a community called Frog Pond just outside McMinnville, Tennessee.
target: West was born in McMinnville, Tennessee.

source: Starr County is a county located in the U.S. state of Texas.
target: Starr County is a county in the U.S. state of Texas.

source: As of the 2010 census, its population was 60,968. As of the 2010 United States Census, there were 60,968 people residing in the county.
target: In 2010, 60,968 people lived there.

source: Its county seat is Rio Grande City.
target: The county seat is Rio Grande City.

source: The county was created in 1848.
target: It was created in 1848.

source: Iizuka (飯塚市 , Iizuka-shi ) is a city located at the confluence of the Honami and Onga rivers in central Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan.
target: IIzuka is a small city in Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan.

source: Kansas State University (KSU), commonly shortened to Kansas State or K-State, is a public research university with its main campus in Manhattan, Kansas, United States.
target: Kansas State University (often called K-State) is a public university in Manhattan, Kansas, in the United States, although there is also a branch in Salina, Kansas and Olathe, Kansas.

source: Kansas State was the first public institution of higher learning founded in the state and began teaching college-level classes in 1863.
target: It was started in 1863.

source: In Greek mythology, Iris ( ; Greek: ] ) is the personification and goddess of the rainbow and messenger of the gods.
target: Iris was known as the goddess of the rainbow and another messenger for the gods in Greek mythology.

source: According to Hesiod's "Theogony", Iris is the daughter of Thaumas and the Oceanid Electra, and the sister of the Harpies: Aello and Ocypete.
target: Her parents are Thaumas (marine titan) and Elektra (cloud nymph). she had 4 sisters, Arke,Aello,Celaero, and Ocypete her mother = Electra dad= Zephyrus son= Pothos

source: Iris is married to Zephyrus, who is the god of the west wind.
target: Her husband is Zephryus (west wind).

source: Iris is represented either as a rainbow, or as a beautiful young maiden with wings on her shoulders.
target: She is depicted as a beautiful golden goddess, with wings (for flight), sandals, a staff, and a tunic.

source: A zoospore is a motile asexual spore that uses a flagellum for locomotion.
target: A zoospore is an asexual spore that uses a flagellum for moving around.

source: Also called a swarm spore, these spores are created by some protists, bacteria and fungi to propagate themselves.
target: It is also called a "swarm spore". These spores are created by some algae and fungi to multiply themselves.

source: Zoospores may possess one or more distinct types of flagella: "tinsel" or "decorated", and "whiplash", in various combinations. Both "tinsel" and "whiplash" flagella beat in a sinusoidal wave pattern, but when both are present, the tinsel will beat in the opposite direction of the whiplash, to give 2 axes of control of motility.
target: There are two types of flagellated zoospores, "whiplash" and "tinsel" or "decorated". Both "tinsel" and "whiplash" flagella beat in a sinusoidal wave pattern, but when both are present, the tinsel will beat in the opposite direction of the whiplash, to give 2 axes of control of motility.

source: In eukaryotes there are four main types of zoospore, illustrated in Fig. 1 at right: A zoosporangium is the asexual structure (sporangium) in which the zoospores develop in plants, fungi, or protists (such as the Oomycota)
target: A zoosporangium is the sexual structure in which the zoospores develop in a plant, fungi, or protists.

source: Garfield and Friends is an American animated television series based on the comic strip "Garfield" by Jim Davis. In addition to the segments featuring Garfield, the series also included segments featuring the characters from "U.S. Acres", a comic strip Davis was drawing concurrently with "Garfield" when "Garfield and Friends" premiered on television.
target: Garfield and Friends is an animated television show that is based on the comic strip "Garfield". In addition to "Garfield" cartoons, it also features cartoons based on "U.S. Acres", another comic strip created by Jim Davis.

source: The show was produced by Film Roman Productions, in association with United Media in Season 1, United Media/Mendelson Productions in season 2 and 3, United Media/Lee Mendelson Productions in season 4–6, Lee Mendelson Productions in Season 7, and Paws, Inc., and ran on CBS Saturday mornings from September 17, 1988 to December 10, 1994, with reruns airing until October 7, 1995. It also aired on cable television on Nickelodeon for several years.
target: The show aired on CBS from 1988 to 1995 on Saturday mornings.

source: In the United States, the series appeared in syndication from 1993 to 2001, on TBS, TNT, and Cartoon Network from 1995 to 1997, and Nickelodeon from 1997 to 2000.
target: Then reran on Cartoon Network from 1995 to 1997, Nickelodeon from 1997 to 2000, ABC Kids (then known as Disney's One Saturday Morning) from 2000 to 2001, Freeform (then known as ABC Family) from 2001 to 2003, Toon Disney from 2003 to 2006, and Boomerang from 2006 to 2007.

source: Hati or Saturn XLIII (provisional designation S/2004 S 14) is a natural satellite of Saturn.
target: Hati or Saturn XLIII (provisional designation S/2004 S 14) is a moon of Saturn.

source: Its discovery was announced by Scott S. Sheppard, David C. Jewitt, Jan Kleyna, and Brian G. Marsden on 4 May 2005, from observations taken between 12 December 2004 and 11 March 2005.
target: Its discovery was announced by Scott S. Sheppard, David C. Jewitt, Jan Kleyna, and Brian G. Marsden on May 4, 2005, from observations taken between December 12, 2004, and March 11, 2005.

source: Hati is about 6 kilometers in diameter, and orbits Saturn at an average distance of 20,303 Mm in 1080 days, at an inclination of 163° to the ecliptic (165° to Saturn's equator), in a retrograde direction and with an eccentricity of 0.291.
target: Hati is about 6 kilometers in diameter, and orbits Saturn at an average distance of 20,303,000 km in 1080.099 days, at an inclination of 163° to the ecliptic (165° to Saturn's equator), with an eccentricity of 0.291.

source: It was named in April 2007 after Hati, a giant wolf from Norse mythology, son of Fenrisúlfr and twin brother of Sköll.
target: It was named in April 2007 after Hati, a giant wolf from Norse mythology, son of Fenrisulfr and twin brother of Skoll.

source: The Province of Vicenza is a province in the Veneto region in northern Italy.
target: The Province of Vicenza is a province in the Veneto region of Italy.

source: Its capital city is Vicenza.
target: Its capital is the city of Vicenza.

source: The province has an area of 2,722.53 km2, and a total population of 865,082 (as of 2017).
target: The province of Vicenza has an area of 2722.53 km2.

source: Tsutomu Kitade (北出 勉 , Kitade Tsutomu , born September 18, 1976) is a former Japanese football player.
target: Tsutomu Kitade (born 18 September 1976) is a former Japanese football player.

source: Sphinx pinastri, the pine hawk-moth, is a moth of the family Sphingidae.
target: The pine hawk-moth "(Sphinx pinastri)" is a moth of the family Sphingidae.

source: It is found in Palearctic ecozone and sometimes the Nearctic ecozone.
target: It is found in Palearctic ecozone and sometimes the Nearctic ecozone.

source: This species has been found in Scotland but is usually found in England.
target: This species has been found in Scotland but is usually found in England.

source: The larvae feed on Scots pine, Swiss pine, Siberian pine and Norway spruce.
target: The larvae feed on Scots pine, Swiss pine, Siberian pine and Norway spruce.

source: The wings of "Sphinx pinastri" are grey with black dashes.
target: "Sphinx pinastri's" wings are gray with black dashes.

source: The wingspan is 2+3/4 - .
target: The wingspan is 2 3/4 - 3 1/2 inches (7–9 cm).

source: The moth flies from April to August depending on the location.
target: The moth flies from April to August depending on the location.

source: The back of the thorax is grey with two dark bands around both sides.
target: The back of the thorax is grey with two dark bands around both sides.

source: The females lay their eggs in groups of two or three along pine or spruce needles.
target: The females lay their eggs in groups of 2 or 3 along pine or spruce needles.

source: Täby Municipality ("Täby kommun") is a municipality north of Stockholm in Stockholm County in east central Sweden.
target: Täby Municipality is a municipality in Stockholm County in central Sweden.

source: Its seat is located in the town of Täby.
target: The seat is in Täby.

source: Metallic hydrogen is a phase of hydrogen in which it behaves like an electrical conductor.
target: Metallic hydrogen is unusual as the element itself is not an alkali metal, but a diatomic gas.

source: This may help researchers better understand giant gas planets, such as Jupiter, Saturn and related exoplanets, since such planets are thought to contain a lot of liquid metallic hydrogen, which may be responsible for their observed powerful magnetic fields.

source: Extortion is sometimes called the "protection racket" since the racketeers often phrase their demands as payment for "protection" from (real or hypothetical) threats from unspecified other parties; though often, and almost always, such "protection" is simply abstinence of harm from the same party, and such is implied in the "protection" offer.
target: Another form of extortion is offering a business owner "protection".

source: The term "extortion" is often used metaphorically to refer to usury or to price-gouging, though neither is legally considered extortion.
target: The legal definition of extortion varies from one jurisdiction to another.

source: Another key distinction is that extortion always involves a verbal or written threat, whereas robbery may not.
target: Extortion, like robbery and blackmail, are crimes that involve obtaining property by illegal means.

source: In United States federal law, extortion can be committed with or without the use of force and with or without the use of a weapon. In the United States, extortion may also be committed as a federal crime across a computer system, phone, by mail, or in using any instrument of interstate commerce.
target: In all states of the United States extortion is a felony. Extortion may be in person, by telephone, mail, e-mail, text message or any form of wireless communication. If the extortion involves any form of interstate commerce, it may be a federal crime.

source: In blackmail, which always involves extortion, the extortionist threatens to reveal information about a victim or their family members that is potentially embarrassing, socially damaging, or incriminating unless a demand for money, property, or services is met. In England and Wales extorting property and money by coercion is the offence of blackmail which covers any "unwarranted demand with menaces" including physical threats.
target: Blackmail is a form of extortion.

source: He threatened the company that he would make the information public and complain to the Spanish Data Agency if his demands were not met.
target: The threat is usually making damaging or embarrassing information public if demands are not met.

source: A death by natural causes results from an illness or an internal malfunction of the body not directly caused by external forces. "Death by natural causes" is sometimes used as a euphemism for "dying of old age", which is considered problematic as a cause of death (as opposed to a specific age-related disease); there are also many non-age-related causes of "natural" death, for legal manner-of-death purposes.
target: Death by natural causes is often recorded on death records as the cause of a person's death. Death from natural causes might be old age, a heart attack, stroke, illness, or infection.

source: An unnatural death results from an external cause, typically including homicides, suicides, accidents, medical errors, drug overdoses.
target: The "unnatural" causes are usually given as accident (implying no unreasonable voluntary risk), misadventure (an accident following a willful and dangerous risk, which can include drug or alcohol overdose), suicide, or homicide.

source: There is no international standard on whether or how to classify a death as natural vs. unnatural.
target: By contrast, death caused by active intervention is known as unnatural death.

source: The manner of death can be recorded as "undetermined" if there is not enough evidence to reach a firm conclusion.
target: Additionally, a cause of death can be recorded as "undetermined". Additionally, a cause of death can be recorded as undetermined.

source: In economics, a depression is a sustained, long-term downturn in economic activity in one or more economies.
target: A depression is a long period of time in which the economy of a country is not working well.

source: It is a more severe economic downturn than a recession, which is a slowdown in economic activity over the course of a normal business cycle. Under the first definition, each depression will always coincide with a recession, since the difference between a depression and a recession is the severity of the fall in economic activity.
target: A depression is a more severe kind of recession.

source: This depression is acknowledged to be a worse Great Depression than the later Great Depression of the 1930s.
target: As of 2013, some countries in Europe were suffering greater unemployment than they did during the Great Depression of the 1930s.

source: The Great Depression of the 1930s affected most national economies in the world.
target: The Great Depression (1929-39) was the longest lasting and deepest economic depression in the history of the modern industrial world. The Great Depression affected countries worldwide.

source: This depression is generally considered to have begun with the Wall Street Crash of 1929, and the crisis quickly spread to other national economies.
target: It started after the U.S. stock market crash in 1929. The prices on the Wall Street stock market fell from October 24 to October 29, 1929.

source: The spotted bass ("Micropterus punctulatus"), also called spotty, or spots in various fishing communities, is a species of freshwater fish of the sunfish family (Centrarchidae) of the order Perciformes.
target: The spotted bass ("Micropterus punctulatus") also called the Kentucky Bass, is a freshwater game fish in the sunfish family.

source: One of the black basses, it is native to the Mississippi River basin and across the Gulf states, from central Texas through the Florida panhandle.
target: It is a species of black bass native to the lower and central Mississippi River basin in North America.

source: It has also been introduced to southern Africa, where it has become established in some isolated waters.
target: It has also been introduced into other countries.

source: A convenient way to distinguish between a largemouth bass and a spotted bass is by the size of the mouth.
target: But it is distinguished by having a smaller mouth than the largemouth. Unlike the largemouth, the tongue of the spotted bass has a patch of teeth.

source: A spotted bass will resemble a largemouth bass in coloration but will have a smaller mouth. Many anglers who catch a spotted bass mistake it for a largemouth due to the coloration although there are subtle differences. The spotted bass is also often confused with a smallmouth bass or smally for short, but it lacks the vertical bars that are present on the sides of the body of a smallmouth bass.
target: The spotted bass is often confused with the largemouth bass because it has the same coloring.

source: The Alabama spotted is highly prized as a gamefish and average size is much larger than the more common Kentucky spotted bass.
target: The Alabama spotted bass is distinguished by a dark spot on the tail in addition to the one on each gill cover.

source: The spotted bass, like all black basses except the largemouth, has scales on the base portion of the second dorsal fin, its first and second dorsal fin are clearly connected, and its upper jaw bone does not extend back to or beyond the rear edge of the eyes.
target: The spotted bass is a fish with a slender body marked by black on its side.

source: The spotted bass also has small black spots below the lateral line unlike either the large or smallmouth bass.
target: The spotted bass is a strong fighter, once hooked, much like the smallmouth.

source: Spotted bass can be found deeper than smallmouth bass at depths up to 100 ft.
target: In mid-summer, fishing in reservoirs, spotted bass can be as deep as 100 feet.

source: Spotted bass seem to segregated by habitat type from closely related species such as the large and small mouth bass.
target: The same lures that attract other black bass also attract spotted bass.

source: Spotted bass usually feed on small fishes, crayfishes, and aquatic insects.
target: If available it will feed primarily on crayfish. It also preys on minnows, catfish, and insects.

source: The males builds the nest in gravel or other substrate then entices a female to deposit her eggs.

target: The flowers are small and single-sex (monoecious), the female flowers are carried in pairs, the male flowers are wind-pollinating catkins, produced in spring shortly after the new leaves appear.

source: The bark is smooth and light grey.
